Supplier Agreement

These are the terms on which you will supply City Pantry online food delivery service via our website citypantry.com (“the Website”).

Vendor’s Portal

1. You will be given access to the Vendors’ Portal where you can provide details of the items you wish to sell via the Website together with the price you wish to be displayed for each item (“Your Price”). You will indicate whether delivery charges apply and any limit on the quantity of orders you are able to fulfil.

Prices

2. You agree that you will apply Your Price to all items displayed on the Website whether or not they are sold via the Website, directly to the customer or via other channels. Should we find that customers are able to order at a discount by coming directly to you we reserve the right to remove you from the Website.

Marketing

3. You agree that you will not target customers placing orders via the Website for marketing purposes. We reserve the right to remove you from the Website in the event that you breach this term.

4. You agree to use all marketing materials supplied by City Pantry in an appropriate manner as directed by City Pantry from time to time. You will store marketing materials safely and in good condition and will inform City Pantry promptly when your stock of marketing materials is running low. We reserve the right to remove you from the Website in the event that you breach this term.

Orders

5. On receipt of an order via the Website, you will be sent an email with details of the order as well as a text message indicating that the order has been received. You should indicate as soon as possible whether you will accept the order and in any event within 2 hours of the email, giving reasons if you are unable to fulfil it. If we do not hear from you within the 2 hour window you will receive notification that the order has been cancelled. We reserve the right to remove you from the Website should you be unable to fulfil orders on 3 occasions within a 6 month period.

6. You will provide us with a telephone number where texts can be sent and you will ensure that the phone will be in working order and switched on. You will also ensure that the relevant staff have access to email and the City Pantry Vendors’ Portal.

Delivery Communication

7. You will respond to all City Pantry delivery communications as promptly as possible and will notify City Pantry when each delivery has been dispatched.

8. You will notify City Pantry and the customer as soon as you become aware that a delivery is likely to arrive after the time stated in the order, providing an estimate of the revised delivery time.

Late Deliveries

9. You will prepare all orders and arrange for their delivery by the time stated in the order.

10. If a delivery arrives after the time stated, we will refund a portion of the cost of the order to the customer and deduct this sum from your monthly payment as follows:

10.1. If a delivery arrives up to 15 minutes after the time stated and City Pantry and the customer have not been notified of the delay, 10% of the cost.

10.2. If a delivery arrives 15 to 30 minutes after the time stated, 25% of the cost.

10.3. If a delivery arrives 30 to 45 minutes after the time stated, 50% of the cost.

10.4. If a delivery arrives 45 to 60 minutes after the time stated, 100% of the cost.

11. If a delivery arrives more than 60 minutes after the time stated and neither the customer nor City Pantry have agreed to the delay in advance, we will refund the full amount of the order to the customer and deduct this sum from your monthly payment. The customer will also receive credit of the same value of the order which can be used against future City Pantry orders and will be deducted from your next monthly payment. Should this happen twice we reserve the right to remove you from the Website.

12. If a delivery arrives 30 minutes or more before the time stated in the order, we will refund 25% of the cost of the order to the customer.

Food Safety

13. You agree to:

13.1. Provide accurate information regarding allergens for any food advertised for sale through the Website.

13.2. Provide appropriate food options to cater for any dietary requirements requested by the customer, and to label these meals clearly.

13.3. Abide by the relevant regulations on food standards and hygiene in the preparation of food for sale through the Website.

14. You agree that if an order is found not to have contained the appropriate and clearly labelled dietary alternatives as specified by the customer, we will refund the incorrect portion of the order and offer the customer a 15% discount off any future City Pantry order, both of which will be deducted from your monthly payment.

15. You agree to indemnify, defend and hold City Pantry harmless against all losses, costs or expenses which we may incur as a result of you not fulfilling your obligations under clause 13.

Service Standards

16. City Pantry will monitor customer feedback and reserve the right to limit your orders and/or remove you from the Website in the event that the quality of your food or customer service is not of a sufficiently high standard.

Payments

17. Payment for all orders will be made on the 10th day of the month following for all orders delivered during the previous month.

18. 20% + VAT of all transactions that pass through the site (including, where applicable, service and delivery charges) will be retained by City Pantry (the “Commission”).

19. Our Commission will also be chargeable on any order placed directly with you by any customer introduced by City Pantry, for a period of 12 months after the termination of this agreement.

Invoicing

20. You agree:

20.1. That City Pantry will act as your agent, in preparing and issuing VAT invoices to customers for transactions placed through the Website. City Pantry will provide a copy of all invoices raised on your behalf. You are responsible for paying the output VAT shown to HMRC.

20.2. Not to raise your own separate sales invoices for transactions placed through the Website.

20.3. To notify City Pantry as soon as practicable of any changes in your VAT details, registration or business ownership.

20.4. That City Pantry’s aggregate liability in relation to any invoices found to be incorrect shall be limited to a maximum of £1,000.

21. City Pantry will:

21.1. Issue you with VAT invoices for our Commission and any other services provided.

21.2. Inform you if we outsource the process of preparing your sales to a 3rd party.

21.3. Make a new agreement with you if your VAT number should change.

VAT

22. You are responsible for paying your VAT. You will pay your VAT relating to orders generated via the Website to HMRC in full and on time and agree to indemnify, defend and hold City Pantry harmless against all losses, costs or expenses which we may incur as a result of any VAT claim against City Pantry in relation to your VAT liability.

Insurance

23. You shall, at your own expense, effect and maintain adequate insurance cover in respect of the risks relevant to your business, with an insurance office of repute. You shall produce on demand to City Pantry your insurance policy and the receipt for the current year's premium.

Indemnity

24. You shall indemnify City Pantry against all liabilities, costs, expenses, damages and losses (including but not limited to any direct, indirect or consequential losses, loss of profit, loss of reputation and all interest, penalties and legal costs (calculated on a full indemnity basis) and all other reasonable professional costs and expenses suffered or incurred by City Pantry as a result of any claim made against City Pantry by a third party arising out of or in connection with your provision of services or supply of goods ordered via the Website.

Variations

25. No variation of or amendment to these terms shall be effective unless issued by City Pantry in writing. Variations or amendments may be notified to you by email. Your continued use of the Vendor’s Portal shall be deemed as your acceptance of any such variation or amendment.

We are very much looking forward to a successful partnership with you. As we are still in the early stages of the development of City Pantry we will regularly review our agreement with you and notify you via email of any updates. Your continued use of the Vendor’s Portal shall be deemed as your acceptance of any such updates.

If you have any questions in the meantime please do not hesitate to get in touch.
